results.title: Scott no friends
results.brief_description:
This responsive display presents the moment, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

PM Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. His 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised at home and abroad for lacking any real details, except faith that uninvented tech might save the day, and the French president labelled him a liar over the submarine fiasco. Other world leaders made their displeasure to the government’s handling of recent issues known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Prime Minister Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. Not only did the French president label him a liar over the submarine fiasco, his 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised around the world (and at home) for lacking any new funding, policies or details – except faith that yet-to-be-invented tech might save the day. Other world leaders made their displeasure known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo opportunity.

While the original footage in this video was broadcast on 7 News, Labor MP Patrick Gorman (and likely his social media team) added the theme music to TV show Curb Your Enthusiasm, equating the Australian Prime Minister with the fictional version of Larry David, whose ignorance and disregard for social conventions results in awkward, cringe-worthy moments on the show. The addition of end cards further establishes the sitcom style, featuring the names of other coalition members, suggesting that the government’s climate policy is a joke that’s resulted in this bumbling Larry David-like instance of international embarrassment.
description_for_label: PM Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. Not only did the French president label him a liar over the submarine fiasco, his 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised around the world (and at home) for lacking any new funding, policies or details, except faith that uninvented tech might save the day. Other world leaders made their displeasure known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo opportunity.

results.title: Scott Joplin: king of ragtime composers
results.creator_credit: Anastos and Associates and Amelia Anderson
results.brief_description: Presents the life and music of ragtime musician, Scott Joplin, narrated by Eartha Kitt. Includes early film footage of the Mississippi River life and the 1904 St. Louis World’s Fair.

results.title: Scots of tomorrow
results.brief_description: The Junior Secondary Schools in Scotland. Illustrates the wide variety of the school curriculum and its careful integration in the everyday life of the pupils. Stress is laid on the acquisition of practical skills and experience simultaneously with the understanding of principles; all with the child’s needs in adult life clearly in view.

results.title: Scotland: the grand tour
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Riva, Scotia International Television and Alex Riva
results.brief_description: Join John Shedden as he narrates a journey around the sights of Scotland. Included on the stop over are: homes of literary figures Robert Burns and Sir Walter Scott, the River Tweed and the popular activities that she offers, St Andrews Golf Course, University of Saint Andrews, the oldest Norman church in Scotland, Earls Hall, Glamis and Blair Castles, battle sights, the Highland Games, Lang Brothers distillery, pubs, Loch Ness, The Trossachs, Pitlochry, Edinburgh, Loch Lomond, Glencoe, Culloden and many more enticements to potential visitors of this lovely country.

results.title: Scotland: background of literature
results.brief_description: The battlefields of the Border Country, the Lowlands and the rugged Highlands of Scotland have provided the inspiration for the works of Robert Burns, Walter Scott, Stevenson, Defoe and others. Picturing scenes from these various parts of Scotland, the film provides a background for the study and appreciation of the stories and poems of Scottish writers.

results.title: Scotland Yard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Aspects of the work of Scotland Yard detectives are illustrated in an accident following a warehouse robbery and how the various Yard departments and other police departments work in cooperation. Traces the case through from the stealing of a car carrying a load of tea to the conviction of the criminals involved in it. Briefly shows the various methods of identification, namely, by fingerprint, by photograph, and on parade in front of a witness.

results.title: Scorsese x 4: four short films by Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: What’s a nice girl like you doing in a place like this?(USA, 1963, 9m) Scorsese’s first student production which was filmed on a shoestring budget and shows the influence of Fellini, Godard and Truffaut on the budding director. “It’s not just you, Murray!”(USA, 1964, 15m) combines the look of Italian cinema with the gangster film and is a definite step towards Scorsese’s later feature, “Mean Streets”(1973). “The Big Shave”(USA, 1967, 6m) was conceived as a protest against the Vietnam War and remains as one of his most enigmatic films. It went on to win the Prix L’Age d’Or at Ledoux’s Knokke Festival. “Italianamerican”(USA, 1974, 45m) belongs to a later phase of Scorsese’s career and is a highly personal and affectionate portrait of life in America through the eyes of his parents Charles and Catherine. It was financed by an NEH Bicentennial Award intended to encourage documentation of America’s immigrant communities, it was shot in the Scorsese family apartment on Elizabeth Street New York.
